title-group.article-title: Development of General Motors Fourth Generation TPC Tires

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1986 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: General Motors requires that tires used on its vehicles meet certain performance requirements. Since the establishment of this Tire Performance Criteria (TPC) System, tire design, compounding technology, and testing capabilities have improved. Additional performance parameters important to the total tire/vehicle system have been identified and appropriate additional tire performance requirements have been established. Updated TPC test procedures and specifications are presented. Prior to 1984, three generations of TPC specification tires had been developed for General Motors' vehicles. For 1984 and 1985 model years, development of a fourth generation of TPC specification tires was completed. The considerations which led to establishment of performance goals are discussed. Test data in major tire performance categories is presented in general summary form comparing fourth generation to third generation TPC specification tires. Fourth generation tire performance specifications are contained in the Appendix.

ref.mixed-citation: K. G. Peterson, F. D. Smithson, and F. W. Hill, Jr., "General Motors Tire Performance Criteria (TPC) Specification System" Paper 741103 presented at SAE International Automobile Tire Conference, Toronto, Ontario, Canada, October 1974.
"Tire Performance Criteria Procedures and Specifications", General Motors Engineering Publication A-4082, March 1982.
Standard Specification for Standard Tire For Pavement Skid Resistance Tests, ASTM E501-73.
Wet or Dry Pavement Passenger Car Tire Peak and Locked Wheel Braking Traction, SAE Recommended Practice, SAE J345a.
Standard Method of Testing Tires For Wet Traction in Straight Ahead Braking, Using a Towed Trailer, ASTM F408-75.

K. L. Oblizajek and N. Lauer, "A Laboratory Procedure for Evaluation and Diagnosis of the Interaction of Tires With Longitudinally Grooved Pavement", Paper 840070 presented at the SAE International Congress and Exposition, Detroit, Michigan, February 1984.
Rolling Resistance Measurement Procedure for Passenger Car Tires, SAE Recommended Practice, SAE J1269.
